title: Refugees worldwide 2001 to 2018
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 3 lines representing Refugees, Internally displaced persons, and Asylum-seekers. The y axis denotes Number of refugees (in millions) and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Refugees, Internally displaced persons, and Asylum-seekers are gradually increasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Internally displaced persons, 2. Refugees, and lastly, 3. Asylum-seekers.

Throughout the period, Internally displaced persons generally had the highest Number of refugees (in millions) relative to others with an average of 28.31, and it reached its maximum at 2018 with a value of 41.43.
Followed by Refugees which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 14.9 Number of refugees (in millions),reaching its highest point  at 2018 with a value of 20.3.
Asylum-seekers mostly had the least Number of refugees (in millions) with a mean value of 1.62, which peaked at 2016 with a value of 6.51.
